page.title: 09NEWBUILDINGS
page.content: To the North East of Copplestone area lies the village of Newbuildings. In this year 1985 there are roughly 70 people and 27 houses in the Newbuildings square. There are two garages and no shops. Four years ago there was a shop which sold a few things but now is closed. There is a playground with swings, a roundabout and a football pitch. There is also a church which is used once a month. The service is held by Charles Edwards. The church used to be a school. In 1773 a Mr.John Ham following the will of his brother Reverent Robert Ham who died in 1770, paid one pound ten shillings to a school master to teach the poor children of Newbuildings. The present building dates back to 1875, but was closed down as a school a few years ago.
